Diminished Capacity.definition: an abnormal mental condition that renders a person unable to form the specific intent necessary for the commission of a crime

1.definition: an abnormal mental condition that renders a person unable to form the specific intent necessary for the commission of a crime (as first-degree murder) but that does not amount to insanity called alsocompare,,,

2 a.definition: a defense based on a claim of diminished capacity

sub_terms.b: the doctrine that diminished capacity may negate an element of a crime

2 a.note: If diminished capacity is shown, negating an element of the crime with which a defendant is charged, the defendant can only be convicted of a lesser offense that does not include the element.
